entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/10. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F56: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/10. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19
entry.dcterms:creator: 1. Róbert, Péter

entry.dcterms:contributor: Hungarian Academy of Sciences Institute of Minority Research (3.)
Hungarian Family and Social Policy Institute (4.)
entry.dcterms:description: 1) subjective financial situation, economic expectations, satisfaction with the work of the government and opposition, satisfaction with democracy 2) popularity of politicians, party preferences, political self-categorization, opinion about the governments after the regime change 3) admitting refugees, taking a job abroad 4) knowledge about the family support system, having children with state promotion, knowledge about social benefits 5) handling health problems, opinions about a possible health information center 6) supporting the compulsory airbag use
entry.dcterms:subject: social welfare policy and systems
social behaviour and attitudes
mass political behavior, attitudes
labour and employment
transport, travel (and mobility)
health condition
economic conditions and indicators
political ideology
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: D, block 4: D, block 5: D (after 2007-09-30: B), block 6: D
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
